correct_answer: Military technology shapes the course of history.

TANKS, AIRCRAFT, SUBMARINES, AND MISSILES Both are significant military technologies that emerged during the 20th century, with tanks, aircraft, submarines, and missiles leading to more mobile and dynamic forms of warfare, and nuclear weapons marking a new era in military technology with the potential for mass destruction NUCLEAR WEAPONS. TANKS, AIRCRAFT, SUBMARINES, AND MISSILES The World Wars of the 20th century drove rapid advancements in military technology, leading to the development of tanks, aircraft, submarines, and missiles WORLD WARS. CANNONS AND FIREARMS Europe was the region where the widespread adoption of gunpowder weapons, including cannons and firearms, led to the decline of traditional medieval warfare tactics and the rise of new military strategies EUROPE. CANNONS AND FIREARMS The Renaissance era in Europe saw the widespread adoption of gunpowder weapons, including cannons and firearms, which revolutionized warfare RENAISSANCE. INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION The Industrial Revolution facilitated the development of more sophisticated and deadly weapons, including rifled barrels, breech-loading mechanisms, and repeating firearms, which transformed the nature of warfare RIFLED BARRELS, BREECH-LOADING MECHANISMS, AND REPEATING FIREARMS.
